intro: Hartogia trilobocarpa, commonly known as the three-lobed holly, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves with three distinct lobes. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by bright red berries in autumn. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a notable species in its native region.
